result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Roehling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to follow all recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  Defendant is to complete a high school diploma or an equivalency.

records.addlTxt:
1:40 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat recites recommendation - defendant will plea to charge with no repeater, with request for probation.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the repeater enhancer be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs
-follow all recommendations of the supervising agent
-complete a high school diploma or an equivalency

Court adjourned at 1:49 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:37 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Scott Blader as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, just received police reports and needs to review them and requests an adjournment.  Court will set for plea & sentencing in 60 days.

Court adjourned at 1:38 pm.
(State's)
Attorney Barbara Privat
Status hearing on July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:13 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barbara Privat.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
Fond du lac County Jail - 06/09/2014 at 12:30 p.m. (Peliminary Hearing)
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

2:04 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Reisha Mitchell present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Mitchell - requests matter be set for Preliminary Hearing - defendant at Fond du Lac County Jail. 

Court directs Preliminary Hearing be held in approximately thirty days - writ to be issued.

Court adjourned at 2:06 p.m.
Status hearing on April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
By Atty Reisha Mitchell

10:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Reisha Mitchell.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mitchell, was appointed to represent the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing in approx 30 days on a Monday or Tuesday.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.
Status hearing on March 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

8:30 a.m.  Michael Roehling's mother called to ask for the Public Defender's phone number.  I explained her son had a hearing today.  She said he is still in custody in Fond Du Lac County, and he is unaware of the hearing today.  He has not received a Notice of Hearing.  She explained that the Public Defender was on vacation at the time of his Initial Appearance and her son was told he would get information about a status hearing in a couple weeks, and has received nothing.  I told her our office was give an incorrect address for the Fond Du Lac Co. Jail, matter would be adjourned one week to March 17, 2014 at 10:00 a.m., and a new hearing notice would be sent.  In the meantime she is going to call the Public Defender's office. 

44
Notice of Hearing for Status Hearing scheduled on 03/10/2014 at 10:00 a.m. has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  C/O Fond du lac County Jail  63 Western Ave  Fond du lac, WI  54935

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.      Defendant is to have no contact with former employer, Graede Casting.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.      Defendant is to have no contact with former employer, Graede Casting.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

9:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Statement by Defendant, he would like to apply for Public Defender.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  No contact with Defendant's former employer, Graede Casting.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.    Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:38 a.m.

Officer Schmidt from Fond du lac County jail called to check on a court appearance on the defendant that is scheduled for 02/24, wondering if we would be doing a writ to get him.  Informed the Officer that if the defendant has huber and is working, and has transportation, we will not do a writ.  The defendant is working the 11:00 p.m. shift, has transportation and should be able to make it here for court.
